blocks.name: expcnv
blocks.content: A sequence of powers of a complex number ` A ` with absolute value smaller than 1 converges to zero. (Contributed by NM, 8-May-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2014.)

blocks.name: explecnv
blocks.content: A sequence of terms converges to zero when it is less than powers of a number ` A ` whose absolute value is smaller than 1. (Contributed by NM, 19-Jul-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm explecnv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, nat0))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(cfv(cabs, c4), clt, nat1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), cle, co(c4, cexp, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wbr(c0, cli, nat0), wbr(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), cli, nat0))
  climsqz2(s0, cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), nat0, cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))), cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0)), cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(c4, cexp, cv(hs0))), universe, w0)

  sylancr(w0, wcel(cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0)), cz), wcel(nat0, cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  ifcl(nat0, cz, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))
  expcnv(hs0, c4, w0)
  recnd(c4, w0)
  eqeltrd(cfv(cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(c4, cexp, cv(hs0))), cv(s0)), cr, co(c4, cexp, cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))))
  reexpcld(c4, cv(s0), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0)))), wcel(c4, cr))
  eqeltrd(cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), cv(s0)), cr, cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))))
  abscld(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))))
  3brtr4d(cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), cv(s0)), cle, cfv(cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(c4, cexp, cv(hs0))), cv(s0)), cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), co(c4, cexp, cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))))

  syl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))), wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(c4, cexp, cv(hs0))), cv(s0)), co(c4, cexp, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s0), cn0))
  elin2d(cv(s0), cn0, c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))))
  fvmpt(hs0, cv(s0), cn0, cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(c4, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(c4, cexp, cv(s0)), co(c4, cexp, cv(hs0)))

  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(c4, cexp, cv(hs0))))

  breqtrrd(nat0, cle, cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), cv(s0)), cfv(cabs, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))))))

  eleq2d(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))), cin(c1, cn0), w0)
  syl5req(cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0))), cin(c1, cn0), cin(cfv(cuz, c2), cfv(cuz, nat0)), w0)
  ineq12i(c1, cn0, cfv(cuz, c2), cfv(cuz, nat0))
  nn0uz()
  sylancl(w0, wceq(cin(cfv(cuz, c2), cfv(cuz, nat0)), cfv(cuz, cif(nat0, c2, wbr(c2, cle, nat0)))), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(nat0, cz))
  0z()
  uzin(c2, nat0)

blocks.content: The partial sums in the infinite series ` 1 + A ^ 1 + A ^ 2 ` ... converge to ` ( 1 / ( 1 - A ) ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2006.)

blocks.content: The recurring decimal 0.999..., which is defined as the infinite sum 0.9 + 0.09 + 0.009 + ... i.e. ` 9 / 1 0 ^ 1 + 9 / 1 0 ^ 2 + 9 / 1 0 ^ 3 ` ` + ... ` , is exactly equal to 1, according to ZF set theory. Interestingly, about 40% of the people responding to a poll at ~ http://forum.physorg.com/index.php?showtopic=13177 disagree. (Contributed by NM, 2-Nov-2007.) (Revised by AV, 8-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: geoihalfsum
blocks.content: Prove that the infinite geometric series of 1/2, 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8 + ... = 1. Uses ~ geoisum1 . This is a representation of .111... in binary with an infinite number of 1's. Theorem ~ 0.999... proves a similar claim for .999... in base 10. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 4-Jan-2017.) (Proof shortened by AV, 9-Jul-2022.)
blocks.origin:

  exprecd(nat2, cv(s0), wcel(cv(s0), cn))
  a1i(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(nat2, cc))

  mp2an(wceq(csu(s0, cn, co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), cexp, cv(s0))), co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), cdiv, co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)))), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)), clt, nat1))
  eqbrtri(cfv(cabs, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)), clt, nat1, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2))

  halfre()
